722945f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 3 views northwestward across the Hudson River, showing the U.S. Fleet thereon, from a vantage point near West 124th Street, which would be between Grants Tomb and the Claremont Inn.
October 13, 1912.
Walter L. Bogert.

715431f-a.text:
West 125th Street, at the North (Hudson) River. The photographer is viewing southeastward to show across Claremont heights the Riverside Babtist Church and Grants Tomb. The viaduct shown carries automotive traffic of Riverside Drive across this gap; the low bridge-like
structure, the New York Central Railroad tracks.
June 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

715396f-a.text:
West 125th Street, south side, at Aighth Ave. (elevated thereupon), showing under demolition two structures slightly west of that point. These are No's. 310 and 312 West 125th Street. The elevated system shown is the Ninth Ave. line, running at this point on Eighth
Ave.
May 1932.
George L. Balgue.

722948f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Claremont Inn in all of its glory, located between
General Grants Tomb and West 125th Street.
